intro: Celosia digynia, commonly known as the flame flower or red dwarf celosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, spiky bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by colorful, showy leaves. Celosia digynia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm, sunny conditions. It is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures for its purported healing properties.
